In order to maintain our high level of delivery standards and meet our customers needs, the Wayfair Distribution team plays a key role in improving customer satisfaction and driving repeat business. Mon,Tue,Thr,Fri 8:30am-7pm

Should have excellent leadership and administration skills and abilities.
Strong motivational, effectual team building, and decision-making skills.
Ability to effectively manage time and resolve crises.

Ability to work overtime as needed.

Title: Training Supervisor
RoleDescription:
Training Supervisor - Global Supply Chain
We are the front-line leaders in the new Wayfair Global Supply Chain Workforce Support Network. We are positioned forward at all the network locations providing direct training & development support to our Supply Chain teams. We bring network-wide resources along with realistic and challenging training initiatives to optimize performance, employee engagement, and professional development for associates and leaders. We are culture enthusiasts throughout our entire Supply Chain network.  
We are looking for a proven leader to influence cross-functional teams responsible for development, standard work, and championing the Wayfair culture in Aberdeen. The candidate must be a collaborative problem solver, strategic planner, one who can build & manage high performing teams in a fast-paced, rapidly challenging, and fluid environment. 
Schedule: 5 day work week (Monday-Friday)
What You'll Do

Coordinate, lead, and execute all training functions within Aberdeen including new hire orientation, job function training, and continuous development.
Organize, develop, and lead a team of exceptional and dedicated Training Ambassadors within the Warehouse Associate population; focus on improving safety, quality, and retention.
Lead various training sessions as needed, including but not limited to: New Hire Fundamentals, Powered Industrial Vehicle (PIV) training, Quality & Process (Current & New SOP) Training.
Provide professional development programming for warehouse associates and leaders. 
Record, track, and drive compliance on all training initiatives and report out on training metrics using Learning Management System.
Partner with Global Supply Chain Training & Engagement, Safety, and Operations teams to develop and improve training resources, strategies, and processes.
Support Global Supply Chain Training, Safety, and Operations by championing new training programs, processes, and initiatives; provide upward feedback and share observations with business owners to improve alignment, compliance, quality, and engagement.
Manage priorities, set goals, and partner strategically with stakeholders to align network training initiatives with the local sites operational and training needs.
Flex to perform work and lead by example on the warehouse floor alongside department leaders and associates during high volume seasons or as needed

What Youll Need

3+ years of experience in Training, Learning & Development and/or Organizational Leadership OR 4 year degree in relevant field, required
Experience in Operations or Supply Chain preferred
Raymond and/or Crown forklift/powered industrial vehicle certifications preferred.  Willingness to be trained on multiple vehicle types required.
Leadership skills and the ability to make decisions with little or no guidance based on policies or best practices.
Exceptional written and verbal communication to effectively communicate with all stakeholder levels.
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
A seek-to-understand mindset and teamwork strategies that will allow you to connect with and influence diverse groups of people, including your training audience and stakeholder network.

Your Role
As a Service Manager, you will be responsible for coaching and developing a team of associates to deliver exceptional service while aligning with our company's goals and values. Title: Senior Product Manager, Shipment Execution
RoleDescription:
Who We Are
This position will comply with our hybrid work model and be expected to sit in our Boston, MA headquarters 3 days/week (T/W/TH)
Wayfair believes everyone deserves a home they love, and that furnishing your home should be a source of fun, not anxiety. Our Product team plays a critical role in making this vision a reality by building technology that solves meaningful customer problems in elegant, scalable, and measurable ways. We work closely with Engineering, Experience Design, Analytics, Third Party system and service providers and business leaders across the company to bring these solutions to life.
 
We are seeking an experienced Senior Product Manager for Supply Chain and Retail Technology to lead a strategic initiative focused on transforming our last mile delivery platform. This includes integrating with third-party execution systems and logistics partners to streamline and scale delivery operations across North America and the UK. In this role, you will optimize the end-to-end shipment execution lifecycle for a diverse carrier landscape to reduce friction in the delivery process, and strong business performance. 
 
Youll act as a connective tissue between engineering, business stakeholders, operations, and external partners to deliver scalable and resilient solutions that power key business functions. This is a high-impact role for someone who thrives in cross-functional environments, can manage complex technical ecosystems, and is passionate about building foundational infrastructure that improves operational efficiency.
 
What youll Do:

Own the long-term (18+ month) product strategy and near-term (6+ month) roadmap for platform tools that integrate with third-party execution systems, prioritizing features that deliver meaningful business impact.
Understand Wayfairs transportation order execution processes and supporting systems, identifying ways to improve efficiency and reduce friction.
Lead discovery efforts to gather and translate internal and external partner needs into clear business and technical requirements.
Collaborate independently with stakeholders, internal technology teams across supply chain, storefront and supplier-facing to drive improvements in speed, cost and customer experience metrics.
Work closely with Engineering, Operations, Commercial, and External partners to deliver on your roadmap and improve team execution.
Plan the phase-out of legacy systems with strategies that ensure a smooth transition to modern solutions without hindering business continuity. 

 
We Are A Match Because You Have:
 

7+ years of product management experience, ideally focused on platforms, APIs, or integrations.
Comfortable discussing API design, architecture decisions, and system workflows with engineers.
Strong track record of leading third-party system integrations (e.g., TMS, ERP) and ability to manage 6+ month roadmap delivery with them. 
Strong communicator with a proven ability to collaborate across engineering, operations, and external partners. Experienced in managing complex projects involving 7+ cross-functional teams. Clear, effective writing is essential and expected in this role.
Skilled at managing stakeholders, including senior leadership, and translating technical concepts for non-technical audiences.
Positive, collaborative, and energetic approach to teamwork.

Wayfair is rapidly expanding its logistics capabilities to support our growth from $16 billion to over $30 billion. We're looking for entrepreneurial leaders to help us build industry-shaping infrastructure and deliver an exceptional customer experience. Our North America Transportation & Delivery organization is at the forefront of this effort, responsible for the strategy and execution of our vast logistics network and carrier portfolio. This is your chance to make a significant impact and drive key initiatives that will propel Wayfair's future.

Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills, with a proven ability to build relationships and collaborate across all levels of an organization.

Title: Full Time Associate, Back of House Retail Operations
RoleDescription:
Full Time Associate, Logistics & Inventory
Location: 3232 Lake Ave Suite 1, Wilmette, IL 60091
Compensation for this role starts at $17/hour.
Overview:As a Logistics & Inventory Ops Associate, you'll be a key player in ensuring smooth inventory flow and back-of-house operations for Wayfair's Physical Retail team. Your responsibilities will include unloading shipments, managing inventory movement, and maintaining product accuracy to create a seamless shopping experience for customers. You will also support our customer facing operations, when there is business need. This role requires attention to detail, comfort with warehouse environments, and the ability to handle heavy merchandise efficiently. The ideal candidate is highly organized, thrives in a fast-paced setting, and is eager to contribute to operational excellence.
What Does a Logistics & Inventory Associate Do?

Demonstrates Reliability: Attendance and commitment to being present and on time for your full shift each day is crucial. This ensures were prepared to support our customers when they need us most. For unexpected events or issues, we require our team members to be proactive in their communications and planning whenever possible.
Receive and Process Shipments: Unload and receive inbound furniture and other products, including manually moving large, heavy goods. Ensure inventory is accurately processed and documented.
Customer Engagement: You will be responsible for owning and delivering a positive customer-facing experience for curbside transactions, carry-out, pickups, returns, and effectively using POS.
Ensure Inventory Accuracy: Use scanning technology to record carton-level details, including product condition, quantity, and location within the store.
Monitor Order Management Systems: Track in-store and online orders processed through back-of-house operations to ensure timely fulfillment.
Manage Inventory Movement: Pick, stage, and move products from storage to the sales floor while maintaining proper organization and placement.
Support Operational Excellence: Collaborate with store teams to resolve inventory discrepancies, maintain accurate stock levels, and uphold Wayfairs commitment to efficiency.
Adhere to Safety Standards: Follow safety guidelines for lifting, equipment use, and warehouse operations to create a secure work environment.

What are the Job Requirements?

Education: High School Diploma or equivalent is required.
Retail or Warehouse Experience: At least 6+ months of experience working in a retail backroom, warehouse, distribution, or logistics environment is preferred.
Physical Capability: Ability to lift up to 50 lbs unassisted and move items 150 lbs+ with equipment or a team lift. Comfortable working in a warehouse/back-of-house environment for the majority of the shift.
Technical Skills: Familiarity with scanning technology and order management systems is preferred.
Adaptability & Problem-Solving: Ability to adjust to evolving processes and take initiative in troubleshooting inventory or logistics challenges.

Additional Physical and Environmental Requirements:

Physical Demands

Frequent movement including standing, stooping, kneeling, crouching
Occasional lifting, carrying, pushing, and pulling up to 50 lbs
Frequent repetitive motions and coordination
Constant handling, grasping, and communication (talking/hearing)
Ability to ascend/descend stairs and balance

Working Environment

Some exposure to cold, heat, and humidity
Occasional noise and vibrations
Minimal hazards and seasonal temperature changes


What are the Benefits*?

 Competitive Pay: Earn competitive compensation with regular opportunities for performance-based increases.
 Career Growth: Access professional development and advancement opportunities to help you grow with us.
 Health Benefits from Day One: Medical, dental, and vision insurance coverage starts on your first day.
 Time to Recharge: Start accruing paid time off immediatelybecause work-life balance matters.
 401(k) with Company Match: Well match up to 4% to help you plan for your future.
 Tuition Reimbursement: Eligible after 6 months of employmentlearn, grow, and get support along the way.

Title: Machine Learning Scientist I - Experienced Graduates
RoleDescription:
Machine Learning Scientist I - Experienced Graduates
Summer 2025 Start
Location: Seattle, WA
 
Additional Details:

This is a Seattle-based opportunity with a 3 day in office expectation (Tuesday - Thursday) with 2 days remote (Monday and Friday).

 
Who We Are: 
Wayfair is continuing to expand our commitment to hiring and supporting talent early in their careers, focusing on filling opportunities with experienced graduates who have 1-3 years of experience.
The Machine Learning team builds the algorithmic systems that drive our business. With expansive workstreams (including Search, Pricing, Personalization & Recommendations, Merchandising, Marketing, Measurement, B2B, Computer Vision, Sales, Services, and Supply Chain), and more than 20 specialized sub-teams, the projects that our teams work on directly impact our customers on a massive scale. You will work with great mentors who will help you all the way from defining the problem and identifying the potential solutions to planning the path to take it to product and potentially publishing your work in reputed AI/ML/DS venues.
We work closely with stakeholders across the business to build scalable ML solutions and algorithmic platforms that drive incremental revenue, enhance the customer experience, & improve customer loyalty. The projects that our teams work on are driven from the ground up  we look for entrepreneurial individuals who want to take ownership over their own agenda and thrive in a collaborative team environment. Take for example (1) Developing novel machine learning models in search & recommendations so that the best products can be highlighted to our customers to meet their needs, (2) Optimizing profitability and business strategy by accurately forecasting future demand, costs and margin; (3) Estimating the long-term impacts on customer behavior of short-term actions via experimentation, or (4) Creating machine learning solutions to detect product duplicates across the millions of products in our catalog and scaling the solution to handle real-time uploads of new products by partners. Data is at the heart of everything we do and there is very little at Wayfair that our Machine Learning team does not touch. They work closely with various teams across the business to build and scale novel solutions to business problems via machine learning. With an in-house A/B testing platform and rolling code deployments, our team can quickly and clearly see the impact that its work has on the company at large and the algorithms you create will directly impact the customers experience.
What Youll Do:

Own the full Data Science/Machine Learning lifecycle from conception to prototyping, testing, deploying, and measuring its overall business value
Develop and scale state-of-the-art machine learning methods and quantitative models to address core business problems
Integrate your algorithmic solutions into our technical platforms to run at scale and directly change the experiences of customers on our site
Drive measurable business value collaborating with business teams to change the course of Wayfair
Pilot projects using new open source tools and packages to enable novel machine learning techniques across the company
Uncover deep insights hidden in our vast repository of raw data and provide tactical guidance on how to act on findings
Use data to improve the decision-making of our employees, and ultimately, to enhance the experience of our customers and our suppliers
Work with a team of friendly and motivated scientists working together to build novel solutions to business problems
Collaborate with ML Scientists and software engineers to create maintainable, scalable and debuggable code by bringing strong software development practices
Drive any potential scientific publications based on the results in major Data Science and Machine Learning conferences or workshops

 
What Youll Need: 
Basic Qualifications: 

1-3 years of transferable experience in a corporate environment, including internship and co-op experience.
Masters degree in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Science, Engineering, Computer Science, Statistics/Biostatistics, Economics, Physics, Robotics, Operations Research, etc.) 
Proficient knowledge of structured programming language(s) (e.g. Python)
Experience with languages and tools relevant to data science, including Pytorch/TF, github, pyspark, Docker, SQL, GCP

Preferred Qualifications:

Familiarity with regression and machine learning techniques, such as supervised/unsupervised learning, recommendation systems, reinforcement learning, deep learning, etc.
An affinity for data along with experience leveraging statistics and regression analysis
Intuitive sense of how quantitative and technical work aligns closely with business priorities and business value
Familiarity with data structures, algorithms, OOP, and programming in a team environment
Quick learner with an analytical approach to solving problems as part of a team who has strong communication skills
Ability to thrive in a dynamic environment where there can be degrees of ambiguity
Ability to effectively work with technical leads: ability to synthesize conclusions for non-experts and desire to influence technical decision

RoleDescription:
Who We Are
The Business Trends team collaborates with Wayfair's executive leadership and all business functions to identify, monitor, and address metric trends that drive Revenue and long-term Customer Lifetime Value (CLV). The team analyzes trends and develops a narrative on Wayfair's absolute and relative performance compared to competitors, both in the short-term and long-term. This allows Wayfair's senior leaders to quickly understand performance drivers, triage issues in real-time, and identify areas where plans need to be refined. Business Trends adds value by: 1) driving long-term CLV by unifying the organization around Wayfair's customer value proposition, tracking related input metrics, and driving interventions if customers are not reacting to improvements or if deviations from normal trends are observed; and 2) influencing partner teams to devote resources to areas of the business that need improvement in order to advance overall business performance and share taking.
The team is searching for a Manager to lead Trends for wayfair.co.uk, working directly with commercial leaders in the London office. The leader will be responsible for diagnosing overall business performance and building the narrative. In this role, you will partner closely with UK commercial leadership, including the UK GM, as well as with the wider Business Trends STO, including our Data Engineering team, to further develop self-service reporting.
 
What You'll Do

Analyse and present weekly performance insights for Wayfair.co.uk, and collaborate with partner teams to develop weekly steering decks.
Identify and analyse connections between Wayfair.com and Wayfair.co.uk trends, highlighting key similarities and differences.
Contribute to the Business Trends semi-annual roadmap.
Build and manage trackers using Google's Looker connected sheets to monitor trends for Business Trends and cross-functional partners.
Conduct cross-store investigations spanning Wayfair.com Business-to-Consumer (B2C), B2B, and Wayfair.co.uk. These can include macroeconomic pattern analysis, category/class trends, impact of policies, or experience issues.
Collaborate with peers and the Head of Business Trends to develop the monthly Trends Council narrative.
Partner with Business Trends Data Engineering to define additional needs for metrics & dimensions in the Business Trends Curated Data Layer.
Work with stakeholders to validate data insights and build hypotheses for potential interventions in response to trend deviations.

 
What You'll Need

Experience in analytical, consulting, technology, start-up, or strategy roles.
Bachelors degree from a top-tier institution with a strong academic record in economics, math, statistics, engineering, business, or a related field.
Strong analytical skills  ability to develop analytical hypotheses and assumptions, use data software to conduct analyses, and synthesize findings.
Strong communication skills  ability to succinctly summarize findings, create a compelling narrative, and share/align messaging with stakeholders.
Strong business acumen  ability to understand how various parts of the business interact and how macro and competitive dynamics influence these.
Ability to learn and act quickly, make decisions, and draw conclusions in the face of ambiguity.
Advanced Excel/Google Sheets skills.
Intellectually curious, high energy, with a strong work ethic and a desire to work in a fast-paced, high-stakes team environment.
Experience with SQL or Google BigQuery is a plus.

RoleDescription:
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Bangalore, India and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements.
Who We Are:
Wayfair runs the largest custom e-commerce large parcel network in the United States, approximately 1.6 million square meters of logistics space. The nature of the network is inherently a highly variable ecosystem that requires flexible, reliable, and resilient systems to operate efficiently.

We do all of this in milliseconds, thousands of times per second.

Flex your strength and knowledge on Java, DevOps, and microservices development.
Define and ensure services are built to industry best practices, including observability, architectural patterns, and inter-team dependency mechanisms (like SLOs)
Work closely with architects and other teams across Storefront to breakdown an existing PHP monolith into well defined Java Microservices with clean boundaries and clear API contracts

Identify risks and gaps in technical approaches and propose solutions to meet the department's technical vision
Work closely with product managers, designers, and peer engineering teams to define project requirements and execution plans

3+ years of experience in engineering, with a preference for candidates with a mix of start-up and large-company experience
eComm domain expertise is a bonus

Experienced in architecting and building large-scale, cloud-based, and event-driven systems across various projects
Excellent communication skills with demonstrated experience driving teams forward and ability to influence results
GCP target cloud platform, experience with AWS/Azure at scale
Distributed microservices architectures with well architected domain boundaries
High volume async messaging architectures
Large scale relational and NoSQL style data stores
Common open source platforms, tools and framework, eg: Kafka, Kubernetes, Containerization, Java microservices, GraphQL APIs, Aerospike etc.

Wayfair runs the largest custom e-commerce large parcel network in the United States, approximately 1.6 million square meters of logistics space. We do all of this in milliseconds, thousands of times per second.
 What Youll Do:

Play a key role in developing and driving a multi-year technology strategy for a complex platform. 
Lead multiple software development teams - architecting solutions at scale to empower the business and owning all aspects of the SDLC: design, build, deliver, and maintain.
Directly and indirectly manage several software engineers by providing coaching, guidance, and mentorship to grow the team as well as individuals.
Inspire, coach, mentor, and support your team members in their day to day work and their long term professional growth.
Attract, onboard, develop and retain diverse top talents, while fostering an inclusive and collaborative team and culture (our latest DEI Report)
Lead your team and peers by example. As a senior member of the team your methodologies, technical and operational excellence practices, and system designs will help to continuously improve our domain.
Identify, propose, and drive initiatives to advance the technical skills, standards, practices, architecture, and documentation of our engineering teams.
Facilitate technical debate and decision making with an appreciation for trade-offs
Continuously rethink and push the status quo, even when it challenges your/our established  ideas.

What Youll Need:

Results-oriented, collaborative, pragmatic, and continuous improvement mindset
Hands-on experience driving release engineering within high-growth environments, previous platform experience is required.
Good understanding of modern deployment methodologies including progressive, green/blue, etc.
Experience working with containers, container orchestration and deploy automation
12+ years of experience in engineering, out of which at least 5-6 years spent in leadinghighly performant teams .
Experience making architectural and design-related decisions for large scale platforms,understanding the tradeoffs between time-to-market vs. flexibility.
Significant experience and vocation in managing and enabling peoples growth and performance. 
Experience designing and building high-scale generalizable products with outstanding user experience. Practical experience in hiring and developing engineering teams and culture and leading interdisciplinary teams in a fast-paced agile environment.
Capability to communicate and collaborate across the wider organization, influencing decisions with and without direct authority and always with inclusive, adaptable, and persuasive communication.
Analytical and decision-making skills that integrate technical and business requirements

Title: Retail Specialist, Interior Designer
RoleDescription:
Location: 3232 Lake Ave Suite 1, Wilmette, IL 60091
Role Overview:
At Wayfair, we believe everyone deserves a home they loveand as a Design Specialist, youll help make that happen. You'll be more than a salesperson; youll be a trusted design partner, guiding customers through everything from furniture selections to full-room transformations. Using your interior design expertise, trend awareness, and flair for customer service, youll help bring their vision to lifewhether in-store, virtually, or in their home.
This role blends creativity and strategy, giving you the tools to inspire and the autonomy to deliver results. From room layouts to fabric swatches, your design solutions will reflect each customers unique style, budget, and needs. Were not just a storewere a community of creators, doers, and dreamers. At Wayfair, youll join a team that cheers each other on, celebrates wins big and small, and knows that building beautiful homes should also be fun.
Ready to help customers fall in love with their homesand your career? Lets make it happen.
What Does A Retail Design Specialist Do?

 Be the Customers Trusted Advisor: Greet, listen, and learn. Youll lead design consultations that feel more like conversations, getting to know your customers style, needs, and how they really live. Whether its a growing family, a new pet, or a dream remodel, youll help it all come together beautifully.
 Turn Vision Into Reality: Create stunning, functional spaces using your design expertisethink color theory, spatial planning , textiles, and trend-savvy picks. You'll walk customers through fabric swatches, finishes, and product choices with confidence and clarity.
 Inspire with Tech + Tools: Build out 2D/3D room views, mood boards, and persuasive presentations using our design software. (Bonus points if youve dabbled in tools like SketchUp, DesignFiles, Floorplanner, Icovia, or a similar tool!)
 Always Be Designing (and Selling): Every interaction is a chance to build trust and drive results. Youll grow sales by turning design dreams into shoppable plansand guiding customers every step of the way.
 Multitask with Purpose: Balance design appointments, sales floor chats, team collabsyoull handle it all with a positive attitude and a flexible mindset.
 Be a Team Player: Pitch in on floor sets, help with replenishment, and share your best design hacks with the team. We grow together here.
 Drive Sales with Style: Every interaction is an opportunity to build trust, grow your pipeline, and close the loop on beautiful, functional spaces. Youll actively seek out leads and help customers take the next step.

Youll Thrive in this Role if You Have:

 Sales Chops: 2+ years of sales experience, ideally with higher price-point products or in a design-related retail environment.
 Design Know-How: At least 1 year of experience in interior, architectural, or graphic designplus a solid grasp of spatial planning, color theory, and style trends.
 Flexibility: Open availability, including evenings, weekends, and holidays. Youre ready when your customers are.
 Tech Savviness: Youre comfortable using design tools (AutoCAD, SketchUp, DesignFiles, etc.), POS systems, and platforms like Salesforce.
 Team Spirit: You shine in a collaborative, cross-functional environment and love being part of a supportive, high-performing crew.
 Great People Skills: You're a strong communicator with the confidence to guide, advise, and build trust with customers from all walks of life.
 A Hustle Mindset: You thrive in a fast-paced setting and know how to prioritize like a prowhether you're juggling back-to-back appointments or jumping in to help on the floor.
